description: Made from Chardonnay, Pinot Nero and Pinot Bianco, this wine offers a fragrance of lemon peel and yellow flower. The creamy palate offers apple, pear and pastry notes. A smooth texture balanced by fresh acidity yields a clean finish.
title: La Valle NV Primum Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: This is a great Barbera that's loaded with varietal aromas of ripe berry and black pepper. The delicious palate delivers black cherry, white pepper and cinnamon flavors. The round, soft tannins are balanced with fresh acidity, making this perfect to pair with hearty pastas to grilled steaks.
title: Livio Voghera 2011  Barbera d'Alba Superiore

description: Made with native grapes Corvina, Rondinella e Oseleta, this wine has a fragrance of black fruit, raisin and spice. The smooth palate delivers ripe plum and blackberry layered with pepper notes and a hint of cocoa.
title: Masi 2009 Brolo Campofiorin Red (Veronese)

description: Righey is a lovely Moscato that shows all the pedigree of Moscato d'Asti. It has aromas of ripe peach, ginger and dried sage that carry over to the palate along with a frothy texture and crisp, quenching acidity that leaves the palate feeling cleansed. It's perfect for brunch or picnics.
title: Montaribaldi 2012 Righey  (Moscato d'Asti)

description: Mediterra opens with intense aromas of bell pepper, red currants, sage and black pepper. The round palate offers lush plum and blackberry layered with nutmeg, clove and pepper. Pair it with a variety of foods including cured meats and medium aged cheeses.
title: Poggio al Tesoro 2011 Mediterra Red (Toscana)

description: This delicious and refined Sauvignon Blanc from Tuscany offers classic varietal aromas of crushed tomato vine and green melon. Succulent cantaloupe, peach and apricot flavors are balanced by crisp acidity and a creamy texture.
title: Bindella 2012 Gemella Sauvignon Blanc (Toscana)

description: Fruity in blackberry and dark cherry with a meaty undercurrent, Heritage blends 47% Barbera with 22% Petite Sirah, 18% Alicante Bouschet and 13% Carignane. Meaty and brisk in acidity, it has a brightness to it traditionally inspired field blends don't often have, amidst a core of power and follow-through. This is a great Lodi wine.
title: Borra 2010 Heritage Field Blend Red (Lodi)

description: This lean, firmly tannic wine is more about structure than fruit. There is a burnt, chocolate- and bitter-coffee flavor that gives edge to the palate, while firm tannins enrobe black-cherry fruit. Drink from 2016.
designation: Cuvée Signature Les Charmots Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2011 Cuvée Signature Les Charmots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: A full-bodied wine, ripely fruity while preserving the natural, cool freshness of a Vinho Verde. It is richly endowed with apple and pear flavors, a touch of yellow fruit and a just a hint of spice. One in a series of single variety wines from Vilacetinho.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2012 Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: Serious amounts of new wood dominate this still young wine. It has weight and there is great juicy black currant fruit underneath the dry wood character. Once it opens up again, this is going to be a delicious, structured wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Grand Bertin de Saint Clair 2010  Médoc
winery: Château Grand Bertin de Saint Clair

description: While it is still young, this is a complex wine, with black currant notes supported by firm tannins. It shows wood aging, fresh acidity and a solid core of structure that promises good aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2011 Forma de Arte Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: Brisk acidity, dried herbs, green olives, white pepper and minerals add complexity and earthiness to the raspberry, cherry and cola flavors of this Zin. It's dry on the finish, and stylish enough to accompany fine steaks and rich cheeses, with of course plenty of crusty bread.
title: Quivira 2011 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A zesty, warm dark plum Primitivo rich in leathery coffee and jam and nestled in a wall of finely structured tannins. This is the kind of wine one can describe as having nice legs.
title: Rosa d'Oro 2011 Estate Bottled Primitivo (Clear Lake)

description: Balsam wood, floral berry and herbal aromas rest in front of a crisp, fresh palate with raw acidity and clampy tannins. Olive, pepper, herbal and foresty fruit flavors announce a medium-weight, snappy finish with no obvious oak. This is very nice but at $125 a bottle it has its limits.
title: Santa Ema 2009 Rivalta Limited Selection Red (Cachapoal Valley)

description: With some concentration from skin contact during fermentation, this is a wine with richness, spice and apricot character. The palate is full with hints of toastiness, with the ripeness laced by a fresher burst of lemon acidity, resulting in an overall well-balanced wine.
title: Terra Silvestre 2012 Arinto (Tejo)

description: This is a rich, full-bodied Champagne showing hints of bottle age but mostly crisp, fresh apple and apricot flavors. It's a ripe, fruity wine, from the southern vineyards in the Aube, but with a apple-skin astringency and brisk texture. Drink now–2019.
title: Veuve Doussot 2009 Cuvée Ernestine Brut  (Champagne)

description: Initially this doesn't distinguish itself. The nose deals typical Chilean Chardonnay aromas of corn and stalks, along with warm-weather fruits. In the mouth, however, this is minerally and intense, with driving acidity pushing flavors of oak, cinnamon, toast and baked apple. On the finish, the fruit fades rather quickly while vanilla and resiny oak flavors settle in and take over.
title: William Fèvre 2011 Chacai Chardonnay (Pirque)

description: Funky aromas of game, powdered herb and scorched soil lead the nose. The tightly wound palate isn't very expressive, but eventually shows raw cherry, thyme and a hint of star anise while astringent tannins leave a rough, mouth drying finish.
title: Ascheri 2012 Sorano  (Barolo)

description: Get past the meaty aromas and the wine is smooth, caramel and spice flavored. The wood flavors are prominent suggesting the wine has been aged well. At the end, berry fruits and acidity come through.
title: Borges NV Porto Tawny Reserve  (Port)

description: The wine is all about fresh fruit. Blackberry fruit jumps from the glass with its light tannins and lively acidity. The structure, with just a touch of dryness, is just right to support the boisterous fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: From a region well-known for its sparkling wines, this is a fruity wine with soft acidity and a ripe apple character. It has a light mousse, creamy rather than crisp. Drink now.
title: Caves da Montanha 2009 Grande Cuvée Chardonnay-Arinto Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: Scents and flavors suggest cherry pipe tobacco, along with streaks of dried leaf and lemon oil. It's a rough and tumble, every day red, with some chewy tannins.
title: Cliff Creek 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Southern Oregon)

description: Finished quite dry, this brings tart rhubarb and sour berry fruit to bear, backed with ample acidity. It was whole cluster pressed, blended with Pinot Noir saignée, and cold fermented in stainless steel. It's a good picnic rosé, ready for cured meats and soft cheeses.
title: Coelho 2015 Divertimento Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: This is unusually pale, with a suggestion of a tawny, slightly oxidized hue. The soft entry brings dusty spices and tart cherry fruit. It finishes with some darker, slightly charred tones, and a hint of cigar. Drink up.
title: Dion 2014 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This wine is crisp and fruity. It has attractive acidity, a nice touch of spice and a backbone of minerality. The juiciness leaves a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine Ferret 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine bears the blue label, and includes 20% Sauvignon Blanc in the blend. The grapes were co-fermented and aged in oak. The wine is grassy, woody and herbal, with tart acidity. Unusual, but perhaps it would have been better if left entirely in stainless.
title: Troon 2014 Blue Label Vermentino (Applegate Valley)

description: Charred blackberries and deep caramel notes make up the nose of this wine named after the cellar master. Medium in feel, the palate shows a decent roundness, however racing acids cut the midpalate short. Additional black fruit carry the flavors, with black pepper marking the finish.
title: Veritas 2013 Paul Shaffer 5th Edition Petit Verdot (Monticello)

description: From the area known as Pierres Dorées because of the gold-colored stone used in buildings, this wine is soft and fruity. It carries a touch of tannin along with red-cherry crispness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Salamandre d'Or  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: A bramble patch of aromas and flavors comes to mind in this blend of Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot: spicy raspberry, blackberry and green stems are prominent. The palate is silky and round in feel, with soft tannins melding against a veil of vanilla and butter.
title: Winery at La Grange 2013 Meritage (Virginia)

description: Thin for Cabernet fruit, yet forceful as far as its tannins are concerned, this stiff and chalky wine will show better with hearty food, such as a beef stew. You'll find flavors of cherry candy and espresso grounds, along with a light touch of chocolate-covered orange peel, but a green edge to the tannins is the final impression.
title: Silvan Ridge 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rogue Valley)

description: With Chardonnay from Provence the dominant partner in this blend with Burgundian Chardonnay, this wine is soft and unoaked, with melon and yellow fruit flavors. It has light acidity, enough to give the wine freshness. It is ready to drink.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2014 100 Series Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Aromas of stewed red currants and blackberries mingle with sweet tobacco and vanilla on the nose. These notes carry to the medium-bodied palate that shows a mild concentration of flavors over a buttery lactic feel.
title: The Williamsburg Winery 2013 Trianon Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

description: A simple, straightforward wine, this has an attractive mineral, tangy texture to go with the bright citrus fruit. Crisp and refreshing, it is ready to drink.
title: Château de Santenay 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: This is well done, given the transportation issues involved in producing this wine. The flavors are balanced and true to variety, with details of orange peel and citrus. Though a bit one-dimensional, this is pleasantly quaffable and should be consumed over the next couple of years.
title: City Winery Chicago 2013 Lakeshore Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This blend of 45% Cinsault, 45% Carignan and 10% Syrah offers vanilla-kissed aromas of blackberry, raspberry and plum, as well as a touch of menthol. The slightly creamy, full-flavored palate boasts ripe black-fruit flavors and a touch of milk chocolate, all of which linger through to the medium-length finish.
title: Cuvée Lion d'Or 2015 Red (Vin de France)

description: Full, creamy, lightly toasted aromas give way to a mature, mellow palate that's a bit flaccid. Nutty flavors suggest papaya and melon, while the finish is low on acidity and thus more flat than ideal.
title: Domaine Bousquet 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Tupungato)

description: From a Chablis producer, this rosé is cool, crisp and fresh. It has plenty of red fruits and a tight mineral texture. A smooth caramel flavor balanced by juicy acidity keeps the wine deliciously refreshing.
title: Domaine Céline et Frédéric Gueguen 2015  Bourgogne

description: This wine is light and fruity with citrus and red apples. It misses out on crispness, giving a more rounded character. It should be kept for a few months and drunk from 2017.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2015  Mâcon-Charnay

description: This citrus-laden wine shows its fresh fruits right up front. It is bright, crisp and full of lime and lemon flavors. Spiciness adds extra interest. Drink now.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2014 Terroirs  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This soft wine is ripe with berry fruitiness. It has a warm sunny character while still demonstrating smoothness and flashing bright blackberry flavor and balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Tagus Creek Cabernet Sauvignon-Aragonez Red (Tejo)

description: Floral, fruity aromas, pistachio and peach flavors, and a frothy, sparkling texture create a sweet, fun and light wine.
title: Sequin 2014 Moscato (California)

description: This is a good, medium-bodied wine with light aromas, fairly neutral flavors and a very clean, straightforward personality. It will suit a crowd.
title: Nica 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Choppy plum and berry aromas are mildly raw and herbaceous, but not overly so. Round and standard in feel, this Malbec tastes of creamy, herbal berry fruits that turn slightly green and oaky. Peppery, medicinal, herbal flavors drive the finish.
title: Pascual Toso 2015 Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Light and fruity, this is an easy, immediately accessible wine. Soft apple and creamed-pear flavors are balanced with acidity and a ripe aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015  Mâcon-Villages

description: This Tempranillo is dark and dense, but not loud, with blackberry reduction, herbal stems and mint scents. The palate is rich and round, with grippy tannins, yet there's a lag on the midpalate. Sweet spice notes linger on the finish.
title: Pedernales 2013 Bingham Reserve Tempranillo (Texas)

description: This is a fruity wine with plenty of dried-fruit flavors and sweetness. There is a nice bite of spirit, a touch of wood and acidity to balance the sweetness.
title: Quevedo NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: Ripe and full, this is an apricot-and melon-flavored wine. With this ripeness comes a soft texture that offers some warm acidity and a perfumed aftertaste. From 50+-year-old vines, the wine is attractive now and ready to drink.
title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2014 Domaine des Granges  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The fruit here is attractive, pears and white currants on top of pink grapefruit and orange zest. It shows its structure and its tense minerality only slowly, allowing the acidity to give it a lift and vibrancy. This is a wine that is still young, still smoothing out its hard edges.
designation: Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaucopins Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2006 Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaucopins Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: In the blend are small portions of 6% Syrah, 3% Merlot and 1% Cabernet Franc—winemaker Mike Wade is a meticulous blender—and the nuanced character is immediately apparent. Seductive scents mix black cherry, nutmeg and toffee, leading into rich red and black fruits, licorice and smoke. Just a hint of earth and herb highlight the lightly tannic finish.
title: Fielding Hills 2006 RiverBend Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)

description: Roughly two-thirds Shiraz, the 2006 Henry's Seven is a lush, full-bodied blend that combines dark, feral notes of cola and cured meats with brighter red-fruit flavors and an herbal tinge. It's a bit warm on the finish, but that only serves to accentuate its spicy complexity. Drink now–2012.
title: Henschke 2006 Henry's Seven Red (Barossa)

description: Predominantly Sagemoor vineyard, along with some Champoux and estate grapes, including some old vine fruit and 13% Syrah. Somehow, the Artist Series Cabernet has an open softness that seems more like Merlot; it's lush and approachable, sleek and liquorous, dotted with malted milk/chocolate highlights around deep black cherry fruit. The aromas are lovely, though at first taste it sags a bit in the late going; the fruit falls off and the chocolaty notes take over. The tannins have a little green tea flavor.
title: Woodward Canyon 2006 Artist Series #15 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: Great wine and great value, too. The nose is a blend of floral, graphite and cassis aromas, while the firm and rugged palate is packed with sweet, friendly cookie, chocolate, coffee and berry flavors. If the tannins seem a little aggressive now, time should come to the rescue. Otherwise, there's very little to pick at and a lot more to praise.
title: Odfjell 2006 Orzada Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: From the Orcia area of Tuscany, here's a blockbuster 70-30 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot with deep concentration and thick density. Evident woodshop or carpentry tones come into play, leaving long-lasting flavaors of vanilla bean, chocolate and coffee. The wine has tart, plump tannins that need a few more years of bottle aging before they settle into place. Drink after 2015.
title: Podere Forte 2005 Guardiavigna Red (Orcia)

description: This is a bold, meaty wine with thick aromas of smoke, cured meat, mesquite wood, ripe blueberry and sweet cherry. It makes a grand impression on both the nose and the tongue because of its exceptional density, its supple texture and its impressive length.
title: Poliziano 2004 Asinone  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: This is a gorgeous Cabernet Sauvignon from Sicily with intense aromas of black pepper, exotic spice, green curry leaves and chocolate fudge. It has depth and personality and would pair with succulent cuts of beef.
title: Principi di Spadafora 2005 Schietto Cabernet Sauvignon Cabernet Sauvignon (Sicilia)

description: A beautiful wine with unfolding aromas of orange peel, honey, vanilla and spice, with a viscous mélange of honey, spice and citrus on the palate. Elegant and flinty, with a luxurious finish.
title: Royal Tokaji 2000 Betsek Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

description: Big and saturated is the best way to describe this mammoth blend of Cabernet, Carmenère and Cab Franc. It's full of ripe fruit, coconut and cassis on the nose. Next up is a pure, bulky palate of raspberry, plum and vanilla. There's some sweet, resiny oak notes if you dig deep, but overall it is a high-end, structured red blend. Drink now through 2012.
title: Santa Ema 2005 Catalina Red (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Once again, the amazing Stillwater Creek vineyard comes through with a highly expressive, pure and intense Syrah that captures the heart and soul of a Washington State take on the grape. The sharp flavors of berries and spice mingle proportionately; the tannins are chiseled and the acids just right.
title: Saviah 2005 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The valley is in a remote, warm part of Napa County. The wine is quite good. Rich and softly opulent, it offers waves of red cherry, raspberry, chocolate, orange tea, anise and Asian spice flavors that go on and on. Not an ager, but delicious now and through 2011 or so.
title: Harrington 2006 Wild Horse Valley Pinot Noir (Napa County)

description: Fragrant and expressive, it's got a wonderful lift to the plummy fruit which is spiced up with clove and gamy scents of smoked and cured meats. This is not your typical jammy, fruit-driven Syrah; it's much tighter and more Rhône-like, with fine natural acids and aging potential of up to a decade.
title: Beresan 2006 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Toasted notes of roasted almond, popcorn, dark coffee and vanilla extract set the stage. Doppiozeta is a new wine from Zisola that offers soft, sweet flavors and bright fruit succulence. Pair this wine with lamb, beef or pork.
title: Zisola 2006 Doppiozeta Red (Sicilia)

description: Here is a very likable Aglianico del Vulture with bright spice flavors, big concentration and black fruit. The wine is dark and impenetrable with thick tannins and chewy succulence.
title: Vigne di Mezzo 2004 Efesto  (Aglianico del Vulture)

description: Here's a creamy and sophisticated expression of Pinot Bianco from one of the best-suited territories for this particular grape. The wine offers layered tones of stone fruit, pear and white almond and boasts a very silky feel that rides long on the finish. It's an excellent wine.
title: Volpe Pasini 2006 Zuc di Volpe Pinot Bianco (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: A rich and creamy wine with good structure and plenty of fruit. The nose yields berry essence, vanilla and smoky wood notes, while the palate has depth, layering and composed flavors. There's coffee and chocolate on the finish, and the texture and length seem just right. It's oaky for sure, but this vintage of Q can handle it. Drink now through 2012.
title: Zuccardi 2006 Q Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This succulent Syrah ages 12 months in oak to produce a soft and deeply concentrated wine with penetrating aromas of smoked ham, curry leaves and drying mineral tones. It has a thick, velvety mouthfeel and firm tannins.
title: Principi di Spadafora 2003 Schietto Syrah (Sicilia)

description: Well-executed and very intense, this dense Sicilian Cabernet imparts a few green notes of dried herbs, bell pepper and coffee bean. Here, the rosemary and wild sage nuances are very attractive and the wine sits confidently in the mouth thanks to its firm tannins and solid structure.
title: Principi di Spadafora 2004 Schietto Cabernet Sauvignon (Sicilia)

description: Roccato is a super Tuscan blend of Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon that delivers aromas of mature fruit and chewy succulence in the mouth. The wine has structure and firm tannins backed by round notes of Maraschino cherry and blackberry preserves.
title: Rocca delle Macìe 2005 Roccato Red (Toscana)

description: Built a little more sturdily than some NZ Pinots, Rockburn's 2007 shows fine intensity and purity of black cherry flavors, allied to hints of mushroom, earth and cola. It's full-bodied, with a long, supple finish. Drink now–2015.
title: Rockburn 2007 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Santa Carolina's Reserva de Familia red wines from 2007 are vastly improved from what the winery has done for the past two decades. This wine—along with the RdF Cabernet Sauvignon—show immense color and fruit, but also balance, structure and a friendliness that can't be mass produced. This wine is loaded with cassis, cherry, cola, mint, toast and bacon. And for $15 you'd be hard-pressed to find a better, more complete red from anywhere in the world.
title: Santa Carolina 2007 Reserva de Familia Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Konrad's 2008 Pinot Noir shows quite a bit of toast and vanilla to go alongside its cherry fruit. Gently toasted marshmallows impart a sweet succulence to the wine, making it attractive despite some woody tannins on the finish. Drink now–2014.
title: Konrad 2008 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Vibrant and bright with wild berry and white cherry, this expression of Sangiovese (with small percentages of Canaiolo, Colorino and Malvasia Nera) shows the trademark acidity you can expect of this region.
title: Le Tre Stelle 2008  Chianti Colli Senesi

description: This is an easy-drinking quaffer, the kind most people think of when they hear Riesling. It's off dry but well balanced, with slightly broad melon and peach notes. A nice patio sipper for summer 2011.
title: Skyleaf 2009 Riesling (Waipara Valley)

description: Tropical is how to best describe the bouquet; it's melony and sweet, but not that zesty or pungent. The palate is round and works well, while flavors of orange pith, lime and sweet grapefruit are just lively enough. Drink now or wait for the 2010.
title: Aylin 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Huge flavors in this creamy wine, exploding in pineapples, limes, kiwi fruit and peaches, with a tangy edge of gooseberry. It's dry and acidic and clean. Tastes a little honey sweet, but the tartness balances.
title: Carica 2008 Kick Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: Light, stalky wine with attractive classic black currant flavors and acidity. Light in character.
title: Château Simard 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: Tastes soft and a little tired at the age of six-plus years, with pie-filling raspberry, cherry and spice flavors. A certain dry complexity makes it interesting, but its lifespan is largely exhausted.
title: Collier Falls 2004 Hillside Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This fresh and food-friendly Chianti Rufina opens with lively berry nuances, forest floor and white almond. The wine is crisp and zesty overall.
title: I Veroni 2008  Chianti Rufina

description: A complex, savory Pinot Noir for $12? Yup. Hints of bacon and mushroom are prominent, with just enough cherry fruit to support them. It's light in body, with supple tannins, so drink it over the next six months or so.
title: Lobster Reef 2008 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Aromatic with notes of white peach, florals and just a whiff of petrol, this is fairly dry in style but softened by a gentle grapefruit and limeade sweetness. Finish clean with a refreshing stone and slate note.
title: Lucas Vineyards 2009 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Toasty on the nose, with plenty of baked apple and warmth. The palate is round, smooth and toasty, with caramel running alongside baked apple and pear flavors. Sweet on the finish, plump in feel and good overall in a tropical, fun way.
title: El Huique 2009 Special Selection Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: This easy Chianti Superiore opens with bright red fruit, wild berry and small but determined touches of spice, clove and cinnamon.
title: Fattoria Fibbiano 2007  Chianti Superiore

description: A little too heavy in winemaker intervention. Shows the hand of oak, the funk of lees and a soft, buttery texture. This all dominates the citrus fruit and makes the wine ponderous.
title: Gamble Family Vineyards 2009 Gamble Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)

description: Here's a good, rugged but dry and fruity Merlot for drinking now. It has pleasant cherry, berry, cola, herb and pepper flavors. Production was 5,000 cases.
title: Souverain 2007 Merlot (Alexander Valley)

description: Solidly mainstream in style, Whitehaven's 2009 Sauvignon Blanc displays slightly sweaty aromas to accent its red bell pepper and passion fruit flavors. It's nicely concentrated, with enough palate weight to pair with slightly rich fish or poultry dishes. Drink up.
title: Whitehaven 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A bit soft and heavy, but useful, with a rustic, tannic mouthfeel, and nicely dry. You'll find classic Cabernet flavors of blackberries, black currants and cedar. Drink now.
title: Pedroncelli 2008 Morris Fay Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: This is a thin, sharp Chianti Superiore with thorny acidity and zesty aromas of white cherry and cassis. You'll want to match this wine with a creamy food such as risotto with grated Parmigiano cheese.
title: Poggio al Casone 2007  Chianti Superiore

description: Dry, firm and toasty, this has acidity over a tight black currant character. That makes it feel almost as much wine as Port, the woody character adding to the dry side.
title: Quevedo 2008 Quinta Vale d'Agodinho Vintage  (Port)

description: Fruity, juicy wine, with some acidity pushing through the light structure. It is attractive, with a tangy, spicy edge.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2008 Vintage  (Port)

description: The lightweight of the Passadouro range, Passa has lively berry fruits, soft tannins and acidity to match. It's a drink-now wine, the texture open and ready to go.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2008 Passa Red (Douro)

description: Dry in character, not a heavyweight. The wine has some fresh fruit through the dry tannins and spice. There's good balance, even if the wine is on the light side.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2008 Vintage  (Port)

description: Here's a bright, fruit-forward Merlot with notes of small black berries, black cherry and cassis accented by soft fruit cake spice. Balanced and drinkable with soft tannins and a solid finish.
title: Recanati 2009 Kosher Merlot (Galilee)

description: This is a superb value white that's versatile and perfect for company. Fresh white florals, Asian pear and a touch of pineapple acidity dominate, with softly prickling acidity dancing on your tongue through the close. Light weight but mouthwatering and easy to drink.
title: Recanati 2009 Yasmin Kosher White White (Shomron)

description: Baked red fruit, cherry pie filling and sweet spice dominate the overall character of this wine, with a finish reminiscent of a Christmas fruit cake. Medium weight with vibrant acidity and a clean finish; easy drinking and ready now.
title: Shiloh Winery 2007 Secret Reserve Petite Syrah Kosher Petite Sirah (Judean Hills)

description: Bright and dark all at once with lovely notes of black cherry, bramble and juicy red plum guts all accented with a touch of sweet spice. Silky and smoothly textured with an overall vibrancy and easygoing character.
title: Shiloh Winery 2007 Shor Kosher Barbera (Judean Hills)

description: Ortman reaches into this Central Coast county to produce this slightly awkward wine. It's dry and rich in cherry pie filling, mocha and spice flavors, but has too much acidity, giving it a chile pepper burn.
title: Ortman Family 2007 Salisbury Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Oaky and tart, with pineapple crème brûlée, Asian pear, vanilla and buttered popcorn flavors. A good, crisp Chardonnay to drink now.
title: Q 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A bit burnt in grilled cherry fruit and tart in acidity, but otherwise it's a nice, silky Pinot Noir, with pleasant spice and sandalwood flavors. Drink now.
title: Clos La Chance 2006 Biagini Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Smooth and creamy, with mineral-infused pineapple crème brûlée, green apple butter and smoky oak flavors. Rich, if a little direct. Drink now.
title: Clos La Chance 2007 Liebeler Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Super-fruity, with a fantastic range of blackberry, cherry, currant, blueberry, chocolate and anise flavors. Could be firmer in structure, though, as the texture is overly soft and melted.
title: Cosentino 2005 The Poet 20th Anniversary Meritage (Napa Valley)

description: Very dry, high in acidity, and not particularly charming now in its youth, although there is a certain nobility. Has a tough, hard mouthfeel, with suggestions of ripe red cherries. An ager? Hard to tell. Give it until 2011, then try again.
title: Alma Rosa 2007 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A bit on the sweet, fruity-oaky side, but saved by crisp acidity. Shows jammy pineapple, lemon, buttered popcorn and smoke flavors.
title: Bonterra 2007 Reserve The McNab Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Peppery and hot, almost Porty, with rich flavors of blackberries, cherries, chocolate, bacon and sandalwood. With smooth tannins, it turns soft and spicy on the finish.
title: Brazin Cellars 2007 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: Made from the winery's vineyard in Calaveras County, this white wine is dry and crisp to the point of tart, in the manner of a Pinot Grigio. Offers flavors of citrus fruits, white peach and spices, with a tangy bite of nasturtium flower.
title: Indian Rock 2008 Vermentino (California)

description: A wine with some weight, showing simple fruit and acidity, the texture open and with a high dosage. It is easy, soft and balanced.
title: J. de Telmont NV Grande Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

description: More useful than rich, this Cab is dry and full-bodied, with blackberry, black currant, herb and smoky oak flavors. Drink now.
title: Kunde 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: Dry, spicy red-fruit aromas are solid and standard, while the palate is lean but comfortable, with dry, simple cherry flavors accented by a spot of oak-driven vanilla. Good but as regular as they come. Easy to drink.
title: Familia Schroeder 2007 Saurus Patagonia Merlot (Neuquén)

description: Generally this is a nice South American Chardonnay. The nose offers touches of apple, pear, peach and light oak, while the palate has bounce, acidity and tangy apricot, nectarine and apple flavors. Finishes lively but dilute, with citrus and lemon peel flavors. Hits the target.
title: Familia Schroeder 2008 Saurus Patagonia Chardonnay (Neuquén)

description: Extreme spice, clove, black pepper and dark granite stone characterize the nose of this ripe Aglianico from Southern Italy. Mature notes of strawberry and raspberry play a supporting role and the wine is tart and crisp on the close. It would make an easy pairing to pasta and simple tomato sauce.
title: Fattoria Selvanova 2006 Vignantica Aglianico (Terre del Volturno)

description: The A-Mano brand is associated with consistent value wines from southern Italy and has now branched out to include value northern Italian whites. This luminous Soave offers fresh aromas of apple, citrus and yellow rose.
title: A-Mano 2007  Soave

description: Feels more like Grenache than Pinot Noir, a heavy, full-bodied and soft wine with cherry and sandalwood flavors. Good, but atypical for the variety.
title: Stephen Ross 2007 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Tasty and rich, but the structure is more like a Rhône wine than Pinot Noir. It's dark and heavy, with cherry pie filling, cola and sandalwood flavors. Curiously soft for an Edna Valley wine. Drink now.
title: Stephen Ross 2007 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: A soft style, indicating a higher dosage, that produces simple fruits but also a level of bitterness. The wine is a disappointment from such a famous name.
title: Taittinger NV Prestige Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: Oaky, with blackberry, cherry and currant flavors compromised with mint and oregano, and with a sharp finish. Not going anywhere.
title: Terlato 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Rich flavors of cherries, cola, black raspberries, oranges and pomegranates are wrapped into a silky texture in this Pinot Noir. It's a little deficient in acidity, which makes it taste simple and one-dimensional.
title: Adler Fels 2007 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Dry, minty and sharp, and very peppery, with tobacco, wintergreen, cherry and currant flavors, wrapped into sturdy tannins. Drink now.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2007 Redemption Zin Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Here's an off-dry wine that straddles the border of overt sweetness. It has candied flavors of pineapples, crème brûlée and vanilla cream. Crisp acidity keeps it clean and brisk.
title: Breggo 2008 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

description: A style that brings in raspberry acidity to crispen the soft fruit. A texture of red apple skins gives an edge to the wine, balanced by some final soft sweetness.
title: Canard-Duchêne NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Simple and fruity, with upfront blackberry jam, cherry, currant and cocoa flavors, wrapped into fine, smooth tannins. Tasty, but lacks definition and complexity.
title: Cobblestone 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Fruity and simple, with pie-filling blackberry, cherry and raspberry flavors that have been generously oaked. Almost sweet, a fruit bomb. Doesn't seem likely to age.
title: Cosentino 2005 The Winemaster Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Everybody needs a dry, tart white wine and Coppola has provided us with one in this crisply citric bottling. It's fresh and uplifting in grapefruit, lime and spicy flavors, at a good price.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Bianco Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This delicate white offers aromas of roses and a palate of spice and flowers that are both lively and sweet. Distinctive and elegant. Pair with poultry, pork and seafood.
title: Greek Wine Cellars 2008 Moschofilero (Mantinia)

description: This Cabernet Sauvignon, with 11% Merlot added, offers intense ripeness and a plush texture of soft tannins. Rich blackberry jam and chocolate flavors are layered with soy and leather notes, benefitting from integrated oak.
title: Chimney Rock 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Classic Rioja aromas of earthy berry, cassis and raisin along with cocoa and dry spice notes announce a ripe wine with complexity. A dense palate with good acidity sets the stage for baked berry, cassis and raisin flavors. This Tempranillo is earthy and smooth on the finish. Drink through 2020.
title: Coto de Imaz 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

description: This Bordeaux-style blend, made from 45% Cabernet Sauvignon, 24% Malbec, 16% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Franc, is a complex and layered wine. Pleasant green notes of savory herbs, peppercorn, blackcurrant leaf and brambly berry drive the bouquet, while the medium-weight palate offers flavors of black-fruit skin, char and cigar box all framed by a crushed-velvet texture. It shows good grip, concentration and length, and should drink well through 2021.
title: DeMorgenzon 2014 Maestro Red (Stellenbosch)

description: Yellow-apple notes are clearly expressed on the nose. They also appear with lovely purity on the balanced dry palate which has a rich backdrop of autolysis with hints of rye bread. The mousse is fine and creamy, the finish is dry and lasting.
title: Domaine Mersiol 2014 Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A touch of vanilla can be discerned in the sweet peachy juiciness of this wine which is already apparent on the nose. The palate is fluid, almost plump and rich with these flavors, especially peach and rose, come to the fore. A pleasantly bitter phenolic edge saves this from becoming too rich. Alcoholic warmth is apparent on the rich sweet finish.
title: Dopff Au Moulin 2015 Brand Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Whiffs of honeydew rind and white blossom lend freshness to this light-footed Riesling. It's juicy and sweet with pristine stone fruit and citrus flavors yet revitalizing and spry. Hints of earth and bee pollen lend complexity to the finish.
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2016 Wehlener Sonnenuhn Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: This 100% varietal wine from the producer's prized estate vineyard is soft textured and full bodied—an exploration of leather, blackberry pie, coffee and cigar. With its long, black pepper-inflected finish, it's ready for steak.
title: Frank Family 2014 Patriarch Winston Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: This fine, small-production wine is fermented and aged predominantly in concrete egg—the better to preserve and promote its beautifully crisp, briny green-apple and pear flavors. Its sharp acidity acts as a squeeze of lemon, making it all the more satisfying.
title: Gary Farrell 2015 Rochioli-Allen Vineyards Clone 76 Concrete Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: From Verzenay on the Montagne de Reims this wine is rich, structured and concentrated. It has a rich texture plus spice as well as zesty orange and red-currant fruits. The wine retains some of the tannins of the red grapes although goes much more for a mineral texture. Drink now.
designation: Blanc de Noirs Grand Cru Brut
title: Henriet-Bazin NV Blanc de Noirs Grand Cru Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: This well-made wine is powered by lush red and black fruits and berries. The acids keep it lively and fresh, tannins are polished and the outstanding fruit is a real joy. It's unfiltered and aged in French oak, 50% new.
title: High Pass 2015 Zauberberg Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Notes of apple immediately rise from the glass: Ripe and mellow Golden Delicious as well as crisp Granny Smith. A background of shortbread appears with a little more air. On the palate the mousse is very lively, almost frothy, highlighting the briskness and freshness of this cuvée. Crisp apple and citrus notes underline the purity and freshness against a backdrop of subtle autolysis. The finish is bright and clean.
title: Hoffmann & Rathbone 2013 Classic Cuvée Sparkling (England)

description: Lightly astringent cherry and berry aromas are intriguing and complex. This eases across the palate with weight and ripeness prior to baked berry, cassis and prune flavors. Earthiness becomes a more dominant characteristic the longer this sits. Drink through 2021.
title: Rioja Vega 2012 Reserva Estate Bottled  (Rioja)

description: Light red in color and quite cloudy in the glass, this appellation blend boasts sweet-and-sour spice on the nose, along with kalamata olive, sagebrush, tangy fig and raspberry jam aromas. Its underripe red fruit and piquant olive character on the palate will please those who enjoy the style but turn off those who don't.
title: Roark Wine Co. 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A ripe, raisiny nose with a black-fruit essence and mild warmth leads to a tight and tannic palate. Toasty blackberry and cassis flavors are powerful and include a note of oaky graphite. A dark, spicy finish with full-blast intensity ends the ride. Drink through 2022.
title: Serca 2014 Single Vineyard Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)

description: Aged and fermented in neutral French oak, this luscious wine is smooth and open, with just the right touch of butter, presumably from partial malolactic fermentation. The mouthfeel is creamy and rich, like a peach cobbler, with a splash of butterscotch.
title: St. Innocent 2015 Freedom Hill Vineyard Dijon Clone Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: A slightly tawny color and extra spicy, meaty aromas make this appetizing blend of 75% Grenache, 17% Mourvèdre and 8% Syrah interesting to taste. It's medium-bodied, peppery and savory and is backed by moderate berry flavors.
title: Terre Rouge 2014 L'Autre Red (Sierra Foothills)

description: Whiffs of gooseberry and tart green plums lend a zesty, green tone to this refreshingly mineral off-dry Riesling. It's a concentrated but spry wine, full of fresh lemon and lime flavors glazed by hints of wax and stony minerality. The finish is persistent, edged by a hint of bitter citrus peel.
title: Thörle 2016 Feinherb Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: This well-made wine is concise and focused, with pinpoint flavors of cut pear holding the core. Hints of thin red berry and a whiff of tea-tree oil animate the nose. It's unusual and well made.
title: Alexana 2016 Terroir Series Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: A focused nose with purity, mineral notes and clean white-fruit aromas opens this fine brut nature. The palate is round enough to not be austere, while it carries flavors of white currant, apple and lime. On the finish it maintains its flavors, minerality and clarity.
designation: Privat Laietà Gran Reserva Brut Nature
title: Alta Alella 2014 Privat Laietà Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Exquisite lightness and weightless charm are the two obvious hallmarks of this wine. The merest touch of citrus appears on the nose. The palate has the same restraint and lemony fruit, pitched against a light froth of tiny bubbles. It's lithe and bright, with a dry, brisk finish.
title: Arthur Metz NV 1904 Cuvée Spéciale Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: This blend of 64% Malbec, 21% Merlot and 15% Mourvèdre is forward in ripe red cherry and plum as well as strawberry-rhubarb pie. Notes of cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla bean weave throughout the nose and palate, spicing up the fruity core and lingering on the close. It's smooth and plush, with a crushed-satin texture and excellent overall balance and harmony.
designation: The Bernard Series Barrel Fermented MMM
title: Bellingham 2014 The Bernard Series Barrel Fermented MMM Red (Coastal Region)

description: Enticing aromas of citrus, spring blossom and white stone fruit set the tone on this elegant sparkler. Bright and polished, the silky palate offers Bartlett pear and green apple alongside vibrant acidity and a silky perlage.
title: BiancaVigna 2015 Organic  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: This bottling from a warm part of the upper Carmel Valley is lavish, rich and inviting on the nose, with cassis, French toast, vanilla and lilac aromas. It's thick on the palate, with blackberry syrup, maple and snickerdoodle flavors, cut by bountiful acidity.
title: Boekenoogen 2015 Bell Ranch Vineyard Zinfandel (Monterey)

description: From a dry-farmed patch of land inaccessible to irrigation, this bottling offers rounded blackberry pie, chocolate, sun-baked rock and burnt caramel aromas. It's quite rich and thick on the palate, with baked boysenberry and clove dust flavors, proving a touch sweet.
title: Boekenoogen 2015 Garrett's Vineyard Dry Land Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Broadley offers well-ripened, estate-grown Willamette Valley Pinot Noir at affordable prices. This juicy, concentrated cuvée brings a lively mix of boysenberry, blackberry and black cherry. It was aged for one year in one-year-old French oak. The focus, concentration and sheer pleasure cannot by overstated.
title: Broadley 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Certainly a remarkable value, this brings concentrated flavors of ripe raspberry and cherry liqueur into a big, broad and deep midpalate. The exuberance and depth of fruit is astonishing, and the balancing acidity suggests that the wine will retain its freshness through 2020 and beyond. This is one to buy by the case.
title: Broadley 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A bright touch of candied strawberry shows prominently on the nose of this bottling, with judicious hints of roasted red pepper, herb and peppercorn hiding behind that vivacious veil. The palate is light in body but has plenty of structure to hold up its cranberry and strawberry flavors and peppery spice. Great with a slight chill.
title: Buttonwood 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Enticing scents of wild spring flowers and ripe orchard fruits take center stage on this fragrant sparkler. It's loaded with finesse, boasting creamy apple, ripe white peach and yellow pear alongside a silky mousse, all lifted by fresh acidity.
title: Bisol 2016 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

description: Fragrant scents of spring blossom, wild flower and orchard fruit escape from the glass. Silky and elegant, the tangy palate doles out white peach, green apple and lemon drop alongside a refined perlage and refreshing acidity.
title: Cà di Rajo 2016 Cuvée del Fondatore Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: A blend that is dominated by Chenin Blanc has produced a beautiful lightly honeyed wine. Its apple fruitiness and brilliant acidity give it great crispness along with an added touch of spice. Drink this delicious wine now.
title: Domaine Amirault 2016 Amirault Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

description: Having tasted the 2002 through the 2005, the '04 seems bright by comparison, with aromatics that include forest floor, tar and lively berries. The palate, like all the Poesia wines, is mouthfilling and substantial; flavors of black cherry, boysenberry and mocha are knit together and don't skip a beat.
title: Hélène Garcin 2004 Poesia Red (Mendoza)

description: Katnook's top-of-the-line Cab, the Odyssey, already seems mature, with a touch of brick to its color and some dried fruit flavors. But even if this won't improve further, it's at a lovely spot right now, with a lush, creamy texture, pillowy-soft tannins and wonderful cedar and cigarbox notes. Drink now–2010.
title: Katnook Estate 2002 Odyssey Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

description: Folks who enjoy herbal complexities in their Cabernet shouldn't pass this wine up. Aromas of roasted peppers, eucalyptus and cassis verge on vegetal, but the flavors are more refined, layering rich chocolaty notes over cassis and hints of green pepper. It's only medium-bodied, but still packs in plenty of intensity, evidenced on the long, silky finish. Drink now–2020.
title: Yarra Yering 2004 Dry Red Wine No. 1 Red (Yarra Valley)

description: This is among Campania's best reds. The aromatic intensity and persistency is stratospheric and the wine doles out generous notes of red cherry, charred volcanic tones and licorice. It's also a wine that evolves, limitlessly, in the glass, gaining intensity and purity the longer you wait. The tannins are solid and chewy and the duration of the length is excellent.
title: Mastroberardino 2001 Radici  (Taurasi)

description: Very concentrated and closed up, like a coil. The intense green fruit is followed by plum skins. Crispness, dry but fresh, comes alongside a powerful explosion of flavors.
title: Albert Bichot 2005 Domaine Long-Depaquit Vaudésirs Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: We all wonder if those cult Cabs will age, but there's no doubt that this is a cellar guarantee. Cathy Corison makes her Cabs less ripe than many others, so the alcohol is lower and the acids and tannins are harder and drier. That's in youth. But such is the depth of cherry, blackberry, cassis, cedar and mineral flavors and overall balance that this complex young wine should easily negotiate the next 15 years.
title: Corison 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: From a somewhat difficult vintage, Stephen and Prue Henschke have turned out a wonderful Cab. Eucalyptus, tobacco and cherry aromas lead the way, followed by flavors that add a deep undercurrent of cassis. It's a big, thickly textured wine, with a long, berry-inflected finish. Not that tannic, it should nevertheless drink well through at least 2015.
title: Henschke 2003 Cyril Henschke Cabernet Sauvignon (Eden Valley)

description: The most attractive quality of this Sicilian Moscato is its genuine simplicity and sunny disposition. The wine imparts fragrant floral notes of jasmine and honeysuckle, leaving ample room for peach, lemon zest, fruity apricot and warm honey. It has very good dimension and an opulent silkiness in the mouth with long lasting flavors on the finish.
title: Planeta 2006 Moscato di Noto  (Moscato di Noto)

description: Very rich and juvenile now, with exotic cherry, blackberry, gingerbread, tangerine, herb tea, vanilla oak and spice flavors, this Zin has a thick, tannic intensity that needs time to mature. The power and concentration must come from the mountain vineyard, on the eastern side of the valley. Hold this dramatic, high-alcohol Zinfandel until mid-2008, at least.
title: JC Cellars 2005 Arrowhead Mountain Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

description: Steeliness exemplified in wine. This is crisp and structured, complex with its green fruits, structured acidity and touch of caramel and kiwi. It's the acidity that shows at the moment; needs 4–5 years.
title: La Chablisienne 2005 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Shows young vine jamminess, with fresh, ripe raspberry, cherry and cola flavors. The Williams Selyem balance of acids and tannins of dry elegance is evident, as is the new oak. Complex and supple, this wine needs time in the bottle to show its best. Give it until 2008, and should drink well for years beyond.
title: Williams Selyem 2005 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Chocolate, cherry, blackberry and clove linger long on the nose and open the door to more layered nuances of ripe red fruit to come. This is a sun-kissed wine with plush softness, dusty tannins and a sophisticated personality shaped by 18 months of wood aging in barrique and oak casks.
title: Capichera 2003 Mantènghja Carignano (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Sprightly and delicious, with grapefruit, fig, Meyer lemon and apricot flavors made even brighter by vibrant acidity. This elegant SB will be delicious with a salad of bitter greens, figs, chèvre and grilled shrimp.
title: Fritz 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: Generous in style, with great freshness. The flavors are rich, touched by caramel, ripe white currants and some spice. A fine, red apple skin structure comes through to finish.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2005 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Howard Park's single-vineyard wines continue to impress for their value and consistency. The 2004 Leston is a richly textured, velvety Cab, marked by earthy, loamy scents and classic cassis, vanilla and tobacco flavors. Drink 2009–2015.
title: Howard Park 2004 Leston Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)

description: Those familiar with Morgan's more expensive Chardonnays, such as the Double L (which comprises 55% of this blend) will find true value in this regional wine. It shows similar power and authority in a showy, Chablis-style wine whose acidic, minerally structure frames intense citrus and oak flavors.
title: Morgan 2006 Highland Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Beautiful intensity surrounds this linear, compact and elegant Cabernet Sauvignon. Aromas include berry fruit, balsamic notes, iron-earthy tones and chopped herbs. Nice harmony, good flavors and long persistency; this is a highly recommended wine that boasts the best of its Mediterranean roots.
title: Sella & Mosca 2001 Marchese di Villa Marina Cabernet Sauvignon (Alghero)

description: This wine is much more convincing than Jenke's 2005 Cabernet, reinforcing the concept that Barossa Cab typically performs better in cooler years (2002 was the coolest on record). It's still broad and mouthfilling, but the plum and cassis flavors stay this side of overripe, buttressed by plenty of smoke, vanilla and spice. Long and savory on the finish. Drink now–2015. Imported by 34th Parallel, LLC.
title: Jenke 2002 Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa)

description: This wine is much better than most in its class. The blackberry, graham cracker and exotic spice notes are particular to Bosca, while additional notes of bacon, chocolate and nutmeg add to the pleasure. For anyone looking for quintessential Argentine Malbec at a good price, we say start here.
title: Luigi Bosca 2005 Reserva Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

description: Better than the ‘04, due to its greater structure, Bella Luna's ‘05 Pinot has complex acids and tannins. They provides the architecture for the extremely ripe cherry, raspberry and cola flavors that have been liberally aged in new oak. Best now in its flashy, seductive youth.
title: Churchill Cellars 2005 Bella Luna Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: All the parts of this juvenile wine have not begun to come together. You have ripe, jammy blackberry, cassis and blueberry flavors, firm tannins, evident new oak, and crisp acidity. All they need is time to marry. The wine is 100% Cabernet, and the grapes used to be vineyard-designated by Beringer. Cellar until at least late 2008, and the wine should improve for many years.
title: Corley 2004 State Lane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

description: The 2004 is 89% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Merlot and 100% new French oak. There's plenty of fruit to back up the lavish oak treatment, but this wine needs 3–5 years to integrate its cassis fruit with the overlay of vanilla, chocolate and toasted coconut. It seems a bit coarsely textured at first, then smoothes out nicely with air, gaining length on the finish. Drink 2008–2015.
designation: Coonawarra Estate Terra Rossa First Growth
title: Parker 2004 Coonawarra Estate Terra Rossa First Growth Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Coonawarra)

description: When first opened it is tight and herbal, with the scent of blood. But the subtle hints of rock and spice that underlie the pristine cranberry fruit need some years to unwrap themselves. This new 2006 Schindler comes out swinging, its wild berry fruit laced with earthy, barnyard funk. Tastes like an unbridled mix of fruit and soil, spice and barrel, that adds up to a vibrant, earthy, alive Pinot.
title: Sineann 2006 Schindler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is the second wine from the Château Grenouilles vineyard, very fresh, but at the same time weighty and concentrated, with wood, caramel and generous fruits. Age for 5 years.
designation: Les Fiefs de Grenouilles Grand Cru
title: La Chablisienne 2005 Les Fiefs de Grenouilles Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This blend comes from seven vineyards: John Sebastiano, Shadow Canyon, Thompson, Harrison Clarke, Watch Hill and Stolpman. Melded with 10% Grenache and 1% Viognier, it shows warm gingerbread and blackberry aromas, cut by pencil lead and anise. The flavors expertly balance ripeness with tannins and acidity, offering dynamic ollallieberry, pepper-crusted roast pork, wild herbs and a touch of vanilla on the finish.
title: Dragonette 2012 Seven Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: From an extreme, cool-climate estate vineyard, this Chardonnay is remarkably complex, golden in color and semi-rich in lemon chiffon and intense caramel. Yet it holds back ever so slightly on the lusciousness by offering crisp, tingling acidity. Orange blossom delights in terms of aroma and flavor, with an accent of fennel, too.
title: Flowers 2012 Camp Meeting Ridge Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Structured in firm tannins, this seamless wine offers juicy red cherry and strawberry most significantly, followed by dried herb and hits of baking spice. Layered without being overly concentrated, it's made and owned by Chris Pittenger, who also makes Rhône-inspired wines for Skinner Vineyards in El Dorado County. The name honors wife Sarah's rounded belly while expecting the couple's first child.
title: Gros Ventre 2012 First Born Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This powerful, single-vineyard wine is both fruity and structured. Dense tannins and dark cherry fruits are beautifully balanced with the wood aging. Wait to drink this wine until 2017.
title: Château des Jacques 2012 Clos du Grand Carquelin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Plum, blackberry and toasty aromas are pure, heady and classy. Immediately this wine shows itself to be powerful: The tannins are grating and the overall outlook is far from shy. Toasty, dark flavors of black fruits, spice and licorice end spicy and blackened, with hard-ripping tannins. Best from 2016 through 2026.
title: Clos Mogador 2011 Red (Priorat)

description: Honey tangerines and freesias perfume this dazzling auslese that's full of pristine yellow peach and citrus flavors. It's luscious, almost opulent with fruit, but cut with a shock of lemon-lime acidity that extends the long, long finish.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2013 Bernkasteler Lay Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Dark in color, this muted, thick and brooding wine is rich, intense and still developing. Floral and juicy, it offers wild berry and cherry flavor, accented by a taste of vanilla and caramel. Concentrated, this wine will please Cabernet drinkers, who will enjoy its peppery, oaky finish.
title: Frank Family 2012 Lewis Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: The slightly oxidized nose on this wine, which is sourced from the K Block at Bien Nacido Vineyard and Jim Clendenen's own Le Bon Climat Vineyard, shows seared marshmallow, hot Marcona almonds and honey, with a noticeable alkalinity. The browned-butter palate is cut by a lemon peel zing that evolves into truffle salt and roasted nuts. All elements linger deep into the finish.
title: Au Bon Climat 2011 Nuits-Blanches Au Bouge Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Made from vines that are between 30 and 60 years old, this radiant white opens with aromas that recall white spring flower, mint and pear. The elegant, linear palate delivers concentrated flavors of juicy apple, creamy pear and zesty citrus, with firm acidity. The lingering finish closes on a mineral note.
title: Pieropan 2012 Calvarino  (Soave Classico)

description: CH, the international initials for Switzerland, are here as a reminder of the birthplace of Alice Tavares da Silva, one of the estate's owners. The wine, rich and dense, offers layers of new wood, mint and dark tannins. Seriously ripe, it's produced from old-vine Touriga Nacional, allowing juicy acidity to give some freshness, although the wine is much more concerned with power and longevity. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2011 CH by Chocapalha Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: Earthy hints of pollen and crushed minerals lend complexity to honeyed swathes of peach and raspberry in this delicately framed auslese. It's racy and lithe, yet remarkably penetrating through a long finish.
title: St. Urbans-Hof 2013 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Auslese Erste Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: This 100% Cabernet Sauvignon sees 20 months in 100% French oak, half of it new. This wine has lovely cassis and red cranberry notes at its core, while accents of earth, leather, oak and cedar give it a classic feel. Sizable, dry tannins should integrate with the bright fruit and minerality over time, through 2020.
title: Stags' Leap Winery 2012 The Leap Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Salted peaches, dried apricots, sliced lemons, crushed vanilla beans and oak smoke mark the nose of this wine, sourced from one of the appellation's biggest and oldest vineyards. It's light and crisp on the salty palate, with a fleshy apple flavor, racy acidity and slate-driven minerality.
title: Talbott 2012 Sarah Case Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This packs tremendous flavor into a low-alcohol wine with moderate residual sugar. Peach pit and juice, green apple and citrusy acids start it off. The flavors keep going through a long, complex finish, adding subtle notes of herb and cut grass.
title: Love & Squalor 2013 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: Nervous, racing acidity casts an electric sheen onto pristine yellow cherry and grapefruit flavors. Semidry in style, this light-footed wine is intensely juicy, but elegantly framed by a vein of chalk and saline minerality. It's complex and vibrantly delicious.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2013 Abtsberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: The winery's flagship Cabernet, this offers elements of cranberry and black cherry that slide onto the palate rather than explode. Fig and plum give it a savory edge, around accents of pencil lead, mocha and clove. Rich and soft on the tongue, the wine offers plenty to enjoy now, but it will also yield intrigue over several years, through 2029.
title: Barnett 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

description: This dry-farmed portion of the exciting family-owned estate delivers aromas of cardamom, pomegranate extract, cherry juice, ollallieberry, sweet woods and the yeastiness of a baking croissant. The palate shows cherry pie, pulverized cloves, star anise and more yeast, with a very full mouthfeel and silky tannins.
title: Boekenoogen 2012 Garrett's Vineyard Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is made from Pinot Noir grapes grown in two unlikely places in the Napa Valley: the Foss Valley near Atlas Peak and Spring Mountain. There is incredible deliciousness going on in this ever-so-lightly hued wine that is vibrantly crisp in grapefruit rind and earthy cranberry and raspberry. With the slightest salinity on the back palate, it remains thirst-quenching and memorable from start to finish.
title: Brick & Mortar 2014 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: This is a big, perfumed wine. It is still young, with new wood flavors, touches of eucalyptus and dense, dry tannins. To balance all this structure, the ripe and juicy berry flavors give the wine the richness it needs. Drink from 2017.
title: Campolargo 2011 Rol de Coisas Antigas Red (Bairrada)

description: This single-vineyard wine is structured and dense. Powerful tannins come both from fruit and from wood aging. Underneath the black cherry fruit and fresh acidity are developing. Drink this complex wine from 2016.
title: Château des Jacques 2012 La Roche  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Longtime Winemaker Kathy Joseph has crafted a wine that presents aromas of cherry, raspberry, slate, frozen chocolate chips and a bit of wild mint. Juicy raspberries lead the palate, along with root beer, cola and a touch of eucalyptus, all sailing through the texture of grippy tannins and strong acidity.
title: Fiddlehead 2010 Lollapalooza Fiddlestix Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Made from old plantings of Touriga Nacional in the Alentejo, this is a structured wine. Perfumed and juicy, it's rich in dark fruits and powerful tannins. Like any great wine from this grape, it's ready for aging, still densely textured and immense. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2011 TN Touriga Nacional (Alentejo)

description: Named after the fourth Marques da Alorna, a Portuguese poet of the 18th century, this powerful wine (both in terms of the wine and the heavy bottle) is hugely dense, brooding and still very young. Its tannins dominate, giving strength to the fresh blackberry flavors under all this structure. Drink from 2018.
designation: Marquesa da Alorna Grand Reserva Tinto
title: Quinta da Alorna 2011 Marquesa da Alorna Grand Reserva Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This is a structured and beautifully wood-aged wine. It comes from vineyards high up in the hills above the Douro, giving a balanced character to the wine. Red berries and black plum skins give the fruit, balanced by the dense, dry core of serious tannins. It's a wine for long aging, so don't drink before 2018.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2012 Red (Douro)

description: Squeaky-fresh lemon and lime shine a spotlight against sweet melon and stone fruit flavors in this gossamer-textured spätlese. It's dancingly delicate, yet deeply penetrating on the palate, finishing on lingering notes of hazelnut and white flowers.
title: Schloss Johannisberger 2013 Grünlack Spätlese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Rose petal and sage notes lend a garden-green freshness to this sprightly semidry Riesling. Nervy lemon-lime flavors jolt the palate awake, but are softened by plush tones of apricot and honey. It's a squarely structured wine that's revitalizing sip after sip.
title: Schloss Vollrads 2013 Spätlese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: One of this historic winery's top bottlings, this wine shows aromas of mushrooms, turned earth, wet gravel, chipped slate and rich raspberry syrup. Juicy flavors of raspberry and cranberry are cut by bracing acidity, which lingers through the secondary elements of pencil lead, licorice and truffle.
title: Talbott 2012 Sarah Case Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This blend of 72% Cabernet Sauvignon and 28% Cabernet Franc shows black cherry extract aromas along with leather and an appealing sense of oak-grilled pasilla chile in the background. The easily quaffable but still serious palate is redolent with juicy black cherries and charred plums, leveled with mocha and a tiny bit of herbaciousness that gives balance.
title: Tanner DaFoe 2011 Rogue's Blend Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Ripe, lush and a touch raisiny on the nose, this smells like boysenberry pie and crème de cassis liqueur. Chewy, tannic and a bit heavy in this youthful state, this offering from vineyards in the town of Porrera (Vall Llach's home) delivers blackberry, cassis and prune flavors along with a toasty, chocolaty, oak-heavy finish. Best from 2016 through 2021.
title: Vall Llach 2012 Porrera Vi de Vila Red (Priorat)

description: Aromas of green pear, yellow apple and sage accompany a smoky whiff of flint stone. The structured, vibrant palate delivers a wonderful depth of flavors, including mature apple, white peach, orange zest, grilled rosemary and energizing mineral. It's impeccably balanced, with bright acidity.
title: Villa Raiano 2013 Ventidue  (Fiano di Avellino)

description: Typically young and fruity, this wine is packed with fresh cherry fruits and plenty of acidity. It's almost crisp and should be drunk now.
title: Château de Pizay 2013  Beaujolais

description: This is like a photocopy of a photocopy of a good Pinor Noir. All the parts are identifiable, from the raspberries and persimmons to the toasty oak and vanilla. It's just all a little thinned down and blurry. Drink now with salmon cakes, burgers, brown rice and tofu.
title: Save Me San Francisco 2012 Soul Sister Pinot Noir (California)

description: With apricot, orange, honey, butter cream and vanilla flavors, it's a simple wine at a fair price.
title: Seven Daughters 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: Tough tannins, acidity and extreme dryness mark this Merlot. While it has some nice, complex black cherry and licorice flavors, it's just too astringent to enjoy, and will not age.
title: Varda 2012 Merlot (Carneros)

description: Dry, full-bodied and tannic, it will deal well with a cheeseburger or barbecued ribs. Flavors include blackberry jam and dark chocolate.
title: Pennywise 2012 Petite Sirah (California)

description: Barrel fermented and aged on the lees, this wine is dry, crisp and dull. The orange and peach flavors are watery, oaky and herbal.
title: Vellum 2012 White Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Napa Valley)

description: Melony aromas come with a gritty, oily accent. Although the wine is still zesty on the palate, it is limited in elegance. Flavors of pithy green fruits turn bitter on the finish. The wine is at peak/past peak.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2012 Isidora Sauvignon Gris (Maipo Valley)

description: A fruity wine, it has fresh citrus and pear flavors. It is very light with just hints of texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2012  Petit Chablis

description: Sweet, frothy and very pink, this is a strawberry-jelly rosé, light and fruity. The touch of acidity at the end is very welcome.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2013 Conde Villar Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A bit heavy, soft and dull, it has dried herb, green pea, oak and tropical fruit flavors, without much complexity. It's all right for drinking now.
title: Russian Ridge 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Petrol aromas lead to a wine that has seen some wood aging and that seems to miss out on fruitiness. It has toast, a burned character and a taut texture. The rest of the wine is bland.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Dornas Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Sugary flavors of orange and apricot jam mark this simple wine. It's oaky and creamy, with good acidity.
title: Kessler-Haak 2011 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The texture is off, with hard and bitter tannins. The fruit also is quite ripe, with the black cherries veering into raisins. Oak sticks out in the form of sweet vanilla and toast. The result lacks harmony.
title: Burrell School Vineyards 2010 Estate Reserve Honor Roll Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: An herbal wine, rather green in character and missing fruitiness. Structure and cherry fruits are there but lost in this green stalky character.
title: Casa Cadaval 2011 Vinha Padre Pedro Red (Tejo)

description: A blend of 90% Barbera and 10% Viognier made into a white wine, this bottling is mired in candy apple and white grapy flavors. It's round and otherwise simple.
title: Villa Toscano 2012 White Barbera Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: This Cab is starting to turn raisiny and pruny, and hot in alcohol as well, with a porty taste and a finish that's bitter in tannins.
title: Horned Toad 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A juicy wine, it has soft tannins and gently stalky fruit textures. Black currant fruits accompany fresh, tangy acidity. Not for aging, so drink now.
title: Château Belle-Garde 2012  Bordeaux

description: The light color of this wine continues to the light palate, which just hints at strawberry fruits. Soft, finishing with fresh acidity, this lightweight wine should be drunk now.
title: Domaine Chêne 2011  Bourgogne

description: The fruit on this Syrah is so ripe that the blackberries venture into raisins and prunes. With the glycerine from high alcohol, the wine tastes like a minor Port.
title: Lafond 2010 Lafond Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Sugary and simple in candied cherry and blackberry flavors, this wine will go down easily at a barbecue.
title: Seven Daughters 2012 Winemaker's Blend Red (California)

description: Tannic and hard around the edges, it has a woody character. The black currant fruit is there but spoiled by the rest of the flavors.
title: Château Darzac 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: High alcohol marks this Bordeaux-style blend, giving it heat that accentuates the tannins. The result is tough and dry.
title: Due Cani 2010 Bella's Blend Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Watery pineapple and peach flavors have a heavy jacket of oak-like smokiness. Acidity provides a clean mouthfeel.
title: Masterpiece 2012 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: The cold vintage took its price, making the wine lean and minty.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2011 Flood Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: On the plus side, it's bone dry and delicate in structure, with excellent acidity and sour red cherry candy fruit. But there's an unripeness that suggests raw white mushrooms and bell peppers. Drink up.
title: La Montagne 2011 Bella Collina Vineyard Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

description: This basic, inexpensive Pinot has Syrah and Viognier blended, but overall the wine is fairly generic, with a streak of smokiness in the background.
title: Peltier 2012 Hybrid Pinot Noir (Lodi)

description: This is a creamy and sophisticated interpretation of Greco di Tufo with lush notes of banana cream, honey, mature peach and vanilla. The wine has excellent density and loads of peach flavors with a touch of sour almond on the finish.
title: Fratelli Urciuolo 2007  Greco di Tufo

description: The Singerriedl is the most renowned vineyard in Spitz, and this ripe but cool example shows its great minerality and taut apple skin tannin structure. Rounding the wine out is an attractive, creamy finish.
title: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2007 Singerriedl Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

description: Full-on style of wine, packed with apricot and peach flavors, spiced up with cinnamon, layered with toast and finishing with delicious, open acidity. A wine that shows why St-Aubin is a village that is worth paying attention to.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2006 La Chatenière Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Stevenot has a good record at producing this stainless-steel-fermented wine. It's a savory, complex white, with high acidity framing honeyed flavors of Meyer lemons, limes, papayas, pine tar, slate and vanilla, with a hint of petrol. That sweet-tart tension makes the wine the perfect foil for Asian fusion fare.
title: Stevenot 2007 Verdelho (California)

description: This is the first release of this new wine from Stonestreet. It's Merlot with some Cabernet, Syrah and Cab Franc. Grown in Jess Jackson's high mountain vineyards, it's rich and soft in black currant, cherry, mocha and smoky oak flavors, with smooth, easy tannins. Best now and through 2010.
title: Stonestreet 2004 Fifth Ridge Red (Alexander Valley)

description: From the county right across the Golden Gate from San Francisco comes this dry, elegant Pinot Noir. It has a great structure, with fine acidity, smooth tannins and oak that's been nicely integrated with the fruit. The cherry, black raspberry, orange and cola flavors are tasty.
title: J. Jacaman 2006 Pinot Noir (Marin County)

description: High in acidity, and with a tangy, minerally flourish, this Chard has ripe flavors of pineapples and papayas, enriched with smoky-sweet, vanilla-accented oak. It's a fashionable wine that will go well with rich fare, such as scallops in a cream sauce.
title: Londer 2006 Corby Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Shows the crisp, dry Alsatian interpretation that Anderson Valley gives to Gewürz. The wine bursts with Asian spices that titillate the palate, alongside Mandarin orange, Asian pear, lychee, honeysuckle and vanilla flavors that are delicious. Drink now for its youthful vivacity.
title: Londer 2007 Dry Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

description: Thick, dark concentration sets the stage and segues to spice and oak aromas lavished over black fruit, blueberry, granite and leather. There's also a soapy, lavender-like quality in the back. The wine has thick tannins and good length with bursting fruit flavors.
title: Mastroberardino 2006 Aglianico (Campania)

description: The nose here is truly beautiful and reminiscent of exotic fruit and delicate spring flowers. This is a nicely made wine with balanced aromas and a full but compact feel in the mouth that is crisp and approachable.
title: Mastroberardino 2006 Nova Serra  (Greco di Tufo)

description: This is a luminous and powerful Fiano di Avellino with a very elegant and linear quality that sets it apart. You'll get herbs, cantaloupe and fresh lime. It performs well in the mouth thanks to its thick, creamy texture and boosting alcohol. A Marc de Grazia selection, various American importers.
title: Antonio Caggiano 2007 Béchar  (Fiano di Avellino)

description: Drier and a little firmer than the '04, Davis Family's '05 Pinot is quite extracted in ripe, long hangtime fruit flavors, but the oak influences are as obvious. Cherries, raspberries, red currants, pomegranates and cola flood the mouth, ending in a swirl of peppery Asian spices.
title: Davis Family 2005 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A bit on the sweet, soft side, with mashed raspberry, cherry and blackberry flavors seasoned with vanilla, but the peppery taste and firm tannins uplift this Zin and give it a frisson of pleasure.
title: Dutcher Crossing 2006 Maple Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Erath is now part of the Ste. Michelle Wine Estates portfolio. The white wines, which have long been a strength of the brand, remain fresh and lightly fruity. The flavors of this young Pinot Gris suggest pear skin, grapefruit and lime, and there are bracing acids providing some additional lift. The '07 seems to show a bit more textural density than the previous vintage.
title: Erath 2007 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: Claret is the old British term for the wines of Bordeaux. This wine, the first such from Francis Ford Coppola's Sonoma County winery, is a good buy. It's a bit rustic, but offers smooth flavors of blackberries, currants and chocolate.
designation: Francis Coppola Diamond Collection Black Label Claret
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2006 Francis Coppola Diamond Collection Black Label Claret Red (California)

description: On the nose this is classic Bordeaux, the dusty black currant and tight fruit very obvious. This is a lean wine, with a core of dry tannins, but there is definite black currant juice freshness, the wine showing high finishing acidity.
title: Hans Moser 2005 Cabernet Merlot (Burgenland)

description: Here's a ripe, juicy Chardonnay. Grown in a warm climate, it shows powerful pear jam, baked apple pie and smoky vanilla flavors, with a note of sweetened jasmine tea and a dry, spicy finish of cloves and pepper.
title: Amista 2006 Farrow Home Ranch Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Marked by crisp acidity and mint-infused cherry pie filling flavors, this Pinot finishes a bit sharp. It needs rich fare to soften it, like Ahi tuna or lamb.
title: Artesa 2006 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)
